reviews.text: The Inn At Stratton Mountain sounded very inviting. We hunted around on various sites and eventually found a rate of $98/n for 4 people in a large room with 2 queen beds. This was a good start. However, even though there weren't many people there, we ended up with people staying above us who sounded like elephants at midnight when they finally came in( there isn't much to do in the village past 5pm) so they must have been out drinking. They're air conditioner ran the 2 nights we were there, all the while dripping on the outside of our air conditioner. That sound kept us awake even when they didin't. THere is very little to do in the area. Don't go for more than 2 nights. Even with a pool and some tennis, that's about all there is unless you travel to MAnchester. Not recommended to go unless its ski season. THey advertise its a year round resort, so they need to find more actiivites.
reviews.title: Inn at Stratton- Stay Away!
It is close to the snow & there is a hot tub!
reviews.text: We arrived quite late and didn't know the surroundings so we ended up in Stratton to find this Inn. Stratton is a sleepy place during summer (I don't know how it is during winter though). The receptionist was friendly but wouldn't offer us a discount although we were in a ski resort in the middle of summer, plus there was some constructionwork across the road. As I said, we didn't know the surroundings and it was getting dark, so we agreed for $95 a night...

We stayed in the Stratton Inn last week for two nights as part of a tour of New England.I had read previous reviews and I was very worried about this accommodation as a result.We had no choice as it was part of a package.
reviews.title: Awful Food
Dead Fly Inn
reviews.text: The room was OK and the beds were clean and comfortable.The staff were helpful apart from one surly young man at Reception who needs to do a course in courtesy!

Our biggest complaint was about the food.Breakfasts were just about edible but dinner in the dining room was the worst meal we ate in 10 days touring.There were 47 of us in our group and on our second night we asked our tour guide to organise a coach to take us to a good steakhouse in Manchester 10 miles away where we had a superb meal.
reviews.title: Basic lodging, but fix the *&^# hot tub!!

reviews.text: As most guests in this hotel will have cars it will be easy to get away for dinner and I would say don't eat in the Stratton unless you are a masochist!
reviews.title: Stay Away From the Stratton Mountain Inn!
what a dump
reviews.text: Do not stay here - this is a terrible hotel. Upon our arrival, we entered our room and there were dead bugs everywhere - on the carpet, on the window seat, on all of the furniture. In addition, when we pulled back the comforter there was hair on the bed, and the door to our room was broken and did not lock properly. So, we went down to the front desk and requested our room be cleaned and the door be examined. We left the hotel for the evening and returned almost 7 hours later and nothing - still dead bugs and still a broken door. We angrily went down to the front desk to question why this had not been taken care of, and after much back-and-forth, they finally agreed to move us to a new, clean room. Unfortunately this room was not much better - it still felt dirty, and the air conditioner was broken. I would tell anyone to avoid this hotel at all costs, because it was quite disgusting, and you will not get your money's worth.
